text: Sneedville is a town in and the county seat of Hancock County, Tennessee, United States. The population was 1,282 at the 2020 census. ==Notable people== * Doyle Lawson, a musician, lived in Sneedville as a child. * Jimmy Martin, a musician, was born in Sneedville, dubbed "King of Bluegrass" and inducted into the International Bluegrass Music Hall of Honor. * Morgan Wallen, multi- platinum country pop artist ==Crime== Sneedville and Hancock County are known for being a hotspot for drug trafficking, production, and distribution. Methamphetamine, oxycodone, and opioids have caused a significant impact in the community. ==References== Category:Towns in Tennessee Category:County seats in Tennessee Category:Tri-Cities, Tennessee
title: Sneedville, Tennessee
